channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: Gov. Spencer Cox of Utah vetoed a bill on Tuesday that would have barred young transgender athletes from participating in girls’ sports, becoming the second Republican governor in two days to reject such legislation. https://t.co/i7mJ3Nvhs3

President Biden will impose sanctions this week on hundreds of members of the State Duma, Russia’s lower house of Parliament, according to a person familiar with the planned announcement.
Follow live updates on the Russian invasion of Ukraine: https://t.co/PIMVnltzLC

Charli XCX and two of her friends and collaborators, Caroline Polachek and Christine and the Queens, joined up on a track from Charli’s new album, "Crash." Here's what they say about their camaraderie. https://t.co/CFO5XFRzxb

The CIA warned President Reagan that a Soviet pipeline to Germany was a threat to Western Europe, creating a reliance on Russian fuel.
The pipeline, supported by the oil and gas industry, set up the dependency that helps fund Russia’s invasion of Ukraine. https://t.co/fgwMxBP4CF
Russia’s failure to execute a quick takeover of Ukraine is causing some in Moscow to question Vladimir Putin’s military leadership. https://t.co/9kRkQKySVp

The founder of the Australian megachurch Hillsong, Brian Houston, has resigned after an internal investigation found he had breached the church’s code of conduct at least twice by behaving inappropriately toward two women. https://t.co/lidSwNox05
Breaking News: Moderna will seek emergency authorization of its coronavirus vaccine for children younger than 6, the company said. https://t.co/6TnE4gNPhH

Ukrainian forces mounted counteroffensives on multiple fronts and retook a town outside of Kyiv.
In Russia, President Vladimir Putin’s government responded to its setbacks in Ukraine by expanding its recent draconian crackdown on dissent. https://t.co/RzjpPsMPUR

Gov. Spencer Cox of Utah vetoed a bill on Tuesday that would have barred young transgender athletes from participating in girls’ sports, becoming the second Republican governor in two days to reject such legislation. https://t.co/mm5yhdzLeY

On the second day of Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson's confirmation hearing, Senator Josh Hawley, Republican of Missouri, repeated his misleading portrayal of her as uncommonly lenient on felons who possess images of child sexual abuse. https://t.co/LJblEkmmVV

On the second day of her Supreme Court confirmation hearings, Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson defended her legal philosophy and faced questions about her religious faith from Senator Lindsey Graham of South Carolina. https://t.co/tsszoMI3e5 https://t.co/Hamq105tCf

Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson, President Biden's Supreme Court pick, audibly sighed when Senator Ted Cruz of Texas asked her about "Antiracist Baby" by Ibram X. Kendi, a children’s book he said is taught at the school where she sits on the board of trustees. https://t.co/VMT7EWJFXe https://t.co/StKt16PfyN
Breaking News: A brain implant allowed a fully paralyzed man to communicate using his thoughts, a newly published study reported. https://t.co/ti07i0WZxm
Elon Musk opened Tesla's first European plant, near Berlin, on Tuesday. The $7 billion factory will eventually produce 500,000 electric vehicles a year, the company said. https://t.co/mDztrdyuUI
Russia’s failure to execute a quick takeover of Ukraine is causing some in Moscow to question Vladimir Putin’s military leadership. https://t.co/dX5hoo1hLb

Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson, the Supreme Court nominee, noted on Tuesday that her parents had to attend racially segregated schools, but she did not. She called the generational difference “a testament to the hope and promise of this country.” https://t.co/LlgUK88mMI https://t.co/9Y263PSA0J

Two Republicans claimed on Tuesday that Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson had called former defense secretary Donald Rumsfeld and former President George W. Bush “war criminals.” But she never used that phrase. Here is the context. https://t.co/YO5xD0AY3O

Russia’s “combat power” in Ukraine — comprising more than 150,000 troops massed in Belarus and western Russian prior to the invasion — has dipped below 90% of its original force, the Pentagon said, reflecting the losses Russian troops have suffered. https://t.co/IsHxMo6WBz

Coronavirus cases are rising in 18 European countries, including Britain, France, Germany and Italy, because the authorities are relaxing pandemic restrictions too quickly, a senior WHO official said on Tuesday. https://t.co/fj9AkOhlUE

Russia has withdrawn most of its helicopters from a strategic airport in Kherson, Ukraine, according to satellite images analyzed by The New York Times, in what experts said could be a sign of Russian military setbacks in the south of the country. https://t.co/sTMi26YW2z

In her confirmation hearing, Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson has followed a strategy perfected by Chief Justice John Roberts in 2005: Emphasize your respect for the Constitution and don't take the bait by senators working to elicit a legal point of view. https://t.co/t5NxHQBezT

Senator Lindsey Graham asked the Supreme Court nominee Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson about her politics. “Did you notice that people from the left were pretty much cheering you on?” he asked. “A lot of people were cheering me on, Senator,” she replied. https://t.co/BMdf8KriAL https://t.co/fojFdzP0Vr

Our reporters are providing live analysis of the Supreme Court confirmation hearings for Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson.
Follow updates: https://t.co/QkSAwvixEq https://t.co/gDiez6mYZh

President Volodymyr Zelensky warned Italy’s Parliament that Russia could use its invasion of Ukraine as a stepping stone to enter Europe, and that famine would strike in parts of the world if Ukrainian farmers were unable to continue their work. https://t.co/OQ6OLSiSDA

Senator Lindsey Graham swiveled in his chair, grabbed his bottle of Coca-Cola, and stormed out of the Supreme Court confirmation hearing for Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson.
Follow live updates: https://t.co/UKNCoGyRQi

The Ukrainian military is mounting an aggressive campaign to reclaim territory captured by Russia in southern Ukraine, hoping to use public defiance to bolster military efforts, according to Ukrainian and U.S. officials. https://t.co/Lq9pwJqsu1

Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson gave a lengthy and emphatic counter on Tuesday to Republican accusations that she has been lenient in sentencing defendants in child sex-abuse cases. "Nothing could be further from the truth," she said. https://t.co/h4NEVidohL
Breaking News: A Russian court sentenced Aleksei Navalny, the jailed opposition leader and high-profile critic of President Vladimir Putin, to nine years in prison. https://t.co/bxPU9wvUK0

Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson, the first Black woman nominated to serve on the Supreme Court, appeared on Monday before the Senate Judiciary Committee, expressing her commitment to being an “independent” judge and to applying the law “without fear or favor.” https://t.co/YkRIlSnlkh https://t.co/Y0Rr6zzZnz

Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson described her religion as Protestant, non-denominational, but stopped short of answering Senator Lindsey Graham’s probing questions about her faith as she noted it was not central to the hearings or her ability to do her job. https://t.co/ZAtIhqX2tb
Vastly outgunned Ukrainian fighter pilots are confronting Russian forces in aerial dogfights to defend their skies, with surprising success. https://t.co/diRt15JeOV https://t.co/tk2K1c5vj8

The number of people in the U.S. who died of alcohol-related causes soared during the pandemic, as routines were upended, support networks frayed and treatment was delayed, a new study found.
Deaths were up 25% in 2020 compared with 2019, the report said. https://t.co/6LYVCs2CV7

Republican lawmakers have misleadingly portrayed Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson, President Biden’s Supreme Court pick, as uncommonly lenient on felons who possess images of child sexual abuse.
Here’s a fact check. https://t.co/BH6lruNr8K

Russian forces were expected to quickly win control of Ukraine’s skies, but they have failed to do so. Instead, aerial dogfights are raging over the country.
“Every time when I fly, it’s for a real fight,” said Andriy, a Ukrainian Air Force pilot. https://t.co/wcoCJYdvMl

Russian forces took four Ukrainian media workers from their homes in Melitopol, the National Union of Journalists of Ukraine said. The journalists and some family members were driven in an unknown direction before being released a few hours later. https://t.co/MRanCVQHuV

Countries are “sleepwalking to climate catastrophe” if they continue to rely on fossil fuels, and nations racing to replace Russian oil, gas and coal with their own dirty energy are making matters worse, the UN secretary general warned on Monday. https://t.co/yOvCMeNgb6

President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine condemned Russian attacks on protesters in the city of Kherson and strikes in Zaporizhzhia, where four children were hospitalized.
“The Russian soldiers do not even know what it is like to be free,” he said. https://t.co/nMhSXTNUWK
Experts say a new generation of less destructive nuclear arms may make the prospect of a nuclear strike less unthinkable than it once was. https://t.co/hcBaMzI8gc

While the cause remains unknown, the crash of a Boeing 737-800 NG in China on Monday is the latest crisis for the American plane manufacturer, raising the prospect of renewed regulatory scrutiny. https://t.co/phgzHDs93W

For three weeks, the Ukrainian port city of Mariupol has been without water, heat, electricity and all communication under a merciless Russian assault. More than 300,000 residents remain in the city as fighting has moved onto the streets. https://t.co/inO2bHjnd3 https://t.co/oDps7FgBgM

The plane that crashed on Monday in the Guangxi region of China was a Boeing 737-800, a mainstay of airline fleets with a strong safety record. The narrow-body jet has a maximum range of over 3,000 miles but is often used on shorter routes. https://t.co/yqLBBGsvuw

While others have taken up arms, Anastasiya Magerramova uses her phone as a weapon. The press secretary of a hospital in Kyiv, Ukraine, she documents the civilians who stream in. She feels she is fighting for truth in the information war. https://t.co/bN3MA04our https://t.co/ps1mdD0Cnj
Rewatching “Basic Instinct” at 30: Travel back to 1992, when one of the most popular and talked-about films was also highly problematic. https://t.co/xvz5kpfd3f

President Volodymyr Zelensky's social-media missives and speeches have transformed him into a global symbol of Ukraine’s resistance to Russian aggression. He has emotionally appealed to nations and institutions and their histories to rally support. https://t.co/KddaIE0667

Russian forces occupying the southern Ukrainian city of Kherson are responding to protests there with gunfire, according to images verified by The New York Times. At least one soldier carrying a Russian assault rifle was seen firing directly at protesters.https://t.co/OvBW60RQZK

Drug-addled neo-Nazis. Genocide. American biological weapons factories. The Kremlin has used a barrage of increasingly outlandish falsehoods to justify its invasion of Ukraine. https://t.co/UTyISrWvTw

While others have taken up arms, Anastasiya Magerramova uses her phone as a weapon. The press secretary of a hospital in Kyiv, she works with colleagues to document the civilians who stream in. She feels she is fighting for truth in the information war. https://t.co/alMR621X2z
A crucial supply of the world’s fertilizers and grain is trapped in Russia and Ukraine. As prices soar, fears of global hunger are rising. https://t.co/7lGa44WzB1

Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson resembles so many Supreme Court justices nominated before her: a widely admired, Harvard-educated overachiever with a respected record as a federal judge. But she is going where no Black woman has ever gone in American history. https://t.co/X9NQV6wV2T

Dr. Ashish Jha, the dean of Brown University’s School of Public Health, a respected academic and a practicing internist with minimal government experience, is about to join the White House as President Biden’s new coronavirus response coordinator. https://t.co/SWBMR47pmv
